intro: Tium atratiforme, commonly known as the black-tailed tium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, dark green leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinctive tubular shape. Tium atratiforme is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
